00083 GHOST_SystemX11::
00084 GHOST_SystemX11(
00085 ) : 
00086     GHOST_System(),
00087     m_start_time(0)
00088 {
00089     m_display = XOpenDisplay(NULL);
00090     
00091     if (!m_display) {
00092         std::cerr << "Unable to open a display" << std::endl;
00093         abort(); //was return before, but this would just mean it will crash later
00094     }
00095 
00096     /* Open a connection to the X input manager */
00097 #if defined(WITH_X11_XINPUT) && defined(X_HAVE_UTF8_STRING)
00098     m_xim = XOpenIM(m_display, NULL, (char *)GHOST_X11_RES_NAME, (char *)GHOST_X11_RES_CLASS);
00099 #endif
00100 
00101     m_delete_window_atom 
00102       = XInternAtom(m_display, "WM_DELETE_WINDOW", True);
00103 
00104     m_wm_protocols= XInternAtom(m_display, "WM_PROTOCOLS", False);
00105     m_wm_take_focus= XInternAtom(m_display, "WM_TAKE_FOCUS", False);
00106     m_wm_state= XInternAtom(m_display, "WM_STATE", False);
00107     m_wm_change_state= XInternAtom(m_display, "WM_CHANGE_STATE", False);
00108     m_net_state= XInternAtom(m_display, "_NET_WM_STATE", False);
00109     m_net_max_horz= XInternAtom(m_display,
00110                     "_NET_WM_STATE_MAXIMIZED_HORZ", False);
00111     m_net_max_vert= XInternAtom(m_display,
00112                     "_NET_WM_STATE_MAXIMIZED_VERT", False);
00113     m_net_fullscreen= XInternAtom(m_display,
00114                     "_NET_WM_STATE_FULLSCREEN", False);
00115     m_motif= XInternAtom(m_display, "_MOTIF_WM_HINTS", False);
00116     m_targets= XInternAtom(m_display, "TARGETS", False);
00117     m_string= XInternAtom(m_display, "STRING", False);
00118     m_compound_text= XInternAtom(m_display, "COMPOUND_TEXT", False);
00119     m_text= XInternAtom(m_display, "TEXT", False);
00120     m_clipboard= XInternAtom(m_display, "CLIPBOARD", False);
00121     m_primary= XInternAtom(m_display, "PRIMARY", False);
00122     m_xclip_out= XInternAtom(m_display, "XCLIP_OUT", False);
00123     m_incr= XInternAtom(m_display, "INCR", False);
00124     m_utf8_string= XInternAtom(m_display, "UTF8_STRING", False);
00125     m_last_warp = 0;
00126 
00127 
00128     // compute the initial time
00129     timeval tv;
00130     if (gettimeofday(&tv,NULL) == -1) {
00131         GHOST_ASSERT(false,"Could not instantiate timer!");
00132     }
00133     
00134     // Taking care not to overflow the tv.tv_sec*1000
00135     m_start_time = GHOST_TUns64(tv.tv_sec)*1000 + tv.tv_usec/1000;
00136     
00137     
00138     /* use detectable autorepeate, mac and windows also do this */
00139     int use_xkb;
00140     int xkb_opcode, xkb_event, xkb_error;
00141     int xkb_major = XkbMajorVersion, xkb_minor = XkbMinorVersion;
00142     
00143     use_xkb = XkbQueryExtension(m_display, &xkb_opcode, &xkb_event, &xkb_error, &xkb_major, &xkb_minor);
00144     if (use_xkb) {
00145         XkbSetDetectableAutoRepeat(m_display, true, NULL);
00146     }
00147     
00148 }

00150 GHOST_SystemX11::
00151 ~GHOST_SystemX11()
00152 {
00153 #if defined(WITH_X11_XINPUT) && defined(X_HAVE_UTF8_STRING)
00154     XCloseIM(m_xim);
00155 #endif
00156 
00157     XCloseDisplay(m_display);
00158 }

00161     GHOST_TSuccess 
00162 GHOST_SystemX11::
00163 init(
00164 ){
00165     GHOST_TSuccess success = GHOST_System::init();
00166 
00167     if (success) {
00168 #ifdef WITH_INPUT_NDOF
00169         m_ndofManager = new GHOST_NDOFManagerX11(*this);
00170 #endif
00171         m_displayManager = new GHOST_DisplayManagerX11(this);
00172 
00173         if (m_displayManager) {
00174             return GHOST_kSuccess;
00175         }
00176     }
00177 
00178     return GHOST_kFailure;
00179 }

00181     GHOST_TUns64
00182 GHOST_SystemX11::
00183 getMilliSeconds(
00184 ) const {
00185     timeval tv;
00186     if (gettimeofday(&tv,NULL) == -1) {
00187         GHOST_ASSERT(false,"Could not compute time!");
00188     }
00189 
00190     // Taking care not to overflow the tv.tv_sec*1000
00191     return  GHOST_TUns64(tv.tv_sec)*1000 + tv.tv_usec/1000 - m_start_time;
00192 }

00206 GHOST_SystemX11::
00207 getMainDisplayDimensions(
00208     GHOST_TUns32& width,
00209     GHOST_TUns32& height
00210 ) const {   
00211     if (m_display) {
00212         width  = DisplayWidth(m_display, DefaultScreen(m_display));

00233     GHOST_IWindow* 
00234 GHOST_SystemX11::
00235 createWindow(
00236     const STR_String& title,
00237     GHOST_TInt32 left,
00238     GHOST_TInt32 top,
00239     GHOST_TUns32 width,
00240     GHOST_TUns32 height,
00241     GHOST_TWindowState state,
00242     GHOST_TDrawingContextType type,
00243     bool stereoVisual,
00244     const GHOST_TUns16 numOfAASamples,
00245     const GHOST_TEmbedderWindowID parentWindow
00246 ){
00247     GHOST_WindowX11 * window = 0;
00248     
00249     if (!m_display) return 0;
00250     
00251 
00252     
00253 
00254     window = new GHOST_WindowX11 (
00255         this,m_display,title, left, top, width, height, state, parentWindow, type, stereoVisual
00256     );
00257 
00258     if (window) {
00259         // Both are now handle in GHOST_WindowX11.cpp
00260         // Focus and Delete atoms.
00261 
00262         if (window->getValid()) {
00263             // Store the pointer to the window 
00264             m_windowManager->addWindow(window);
00265             m_windowManager->setActiveWindow(window);
00266             pushEvent( new GHOST_Event(getMilliSeconds(), GHOST_kEventWindowSize, window) );
00267         }
00268         else {
00269             delete window;
00270             window = 0;
00271         }
00272     }
00273     return window;
00274 }

00276     GHOST_WindowX11 * 
00277 GHOST_SystemX11::
00278 findGhostWindow(
00279     Window xwind
00280 ) const {
00281     
00282     if (xwind == 0) return NULL;
00283 
00284     // It is not entirely safe to do this as the backptr may point
00285     // to a window that has recently been removed. 
00286     // We should always check the window manager's list of windows 
00287     // and only process events on these windows.
00288 
00289     vector<GHOST_IWindow *> & win_vec = m_windowManager->getWindows();
00290 
00291     vector<GHOST_IWindow *>::iterator win_it = win_vec.begin();
00292     vector<GHOST_IWindow *>::const_iterator win_end = win_vec.end();
00293     
00294     for (; win_it != win_end; ++win_it) {
00295         GHOST_WindowX11 * window = static_cast<GHOST_WindowX11 *>(*win_it);
00296         if (window->getXWindow() == xwind) {
00297             return window;
00298         }
00299     }
00300     return NULL;
00301     
00302 }
00303 
00304 static void SleepTillEvent(Display *display, GHOST_TInt64 maxSleep)
00305 {
00306     int fd = ConnectionNumber(display);
00307     fd_set fds;
00308     
00309     FD_ZERO(&fds);
00310     FD_SET(fd, &fds);
00311 
00312     if (maxSleep == -1) {
00313         select(fd + 1, &fds, NULL, NULL, NULL);
00314     }
00315     else {
00316         timeval tv;
00317 
00318         tv.tv_sec = maxSleep/1000;
00319         tv.tv_usec = (maxSleep - tv.tv_sec*1000)*1000;
00320     
00321         select(fd + 1, &fds, NULL, NULL, &tv);
00322     }
00323 }

00325 /* This function borrowed from Qt's X11 support
00326  * qclipboard_x11.cpp
00327  *  */
00328 struct init_timestamp_data
00329 {
00330     Time timestamp;
00331 };
00332 
00333 static Bool init_timestamp_scanner(Display*, XEvent *event, XPointer arg)
00334 {
00335     init_timestamp_data *data =
00336         reinterpret_cast<init_timestamp_data*>(arg);
00337     switch(event->type)
00338     {
00339     case ButtonPress:
00340     case ButtonRelease:
00341         data->timestamp = event->xbutton.time;
00342         break;
00343     case MotionNotify:
00344         data->timestamp = event->xmotion.time;
00345         break;
00346     case KeyPress:
00347     case KeyRelease:
00348         data->timestamp = event->xkey.time;
00349         break;
00350     case PropertyNotify:
00351         data->timestamp = event->xproperty.time;
00352         break;
00353     case EnterNotify:
00354     case LeaveNotify:
00355         data->timestamp = event->xcrossing.time;
00356         break;
00357     case SelectionClear:
00358         data->timestamp = event->xselectionclear.time;
00359         break;
00360     default:
00361         break;
00362     }
00363 
00364     return false;
00365 }
00366 
00367 Time
00368 GHOST_SystemX11::
00369 lastEventTime(Time default_time) {
00370     init_timestamp_data data;
00371     data.timestamp = default_time;
00372     XEvent ev;
00373     XCheckIfEvent(m_display, &ev, &init_timestamp_scanner, (XPointer)&data);
00374 
00375     return data.timestamp;
00376 }
00377 
00378     bool 
00379 GHOST_SystemX11::
00380 processEvents(
00381     bool waitForEvent
00382 ){
00383     // Get all the current events -- translate them into 
00384     // ghost events and call base class pushEvent() method.
00385     
00386     bool anyProcessed = false;
00387     
00388     do {
00389         GHOST_TimerManager* timerMgr = getTimerManager();
00390         
00391         if (waitForEvent && m_dirty_windows.empty() && !XPending(m_display)) {
00392             GHOST_TUns64 next = timerMgr->nextFireTime();
00393             
00394             if (next==GHOST_kFireTimeNever) {
00395                 SleepTillEvent(m_display, -1);
00396             } else {
00397                 GHOST_TInt64 maxSleep = next - getMilliSeconds();
00398 
00399                 if(maxSleep >= 0)
00400                     SleepTillEvent(m_display, next - getMilliSeconds());
00401             }
00402         }
00403         
00404         if (timerMgr->fireTimers(getMilliSeconds())) {
00405             anyProcessed = true;
00406         }
00407         
00408         while (XPending(m_display)) {
00409             XEvent xevent;
00410             XNextEvent(m_display, &xevent);
00411             processEvent(&xevent);
00412             anyProcessed = true;
00413         }
00414         
00415         if (generateWindowExposeEvents()) {
00416             anyProcessed = true;
00417         }
00418 
00419 #ifdef WITH_INPUT_NDOF
00420         if (dynamic_cast<GHOST_NDOFManagerX11*>(m_ndofManager)->processEvents()) {
00421             anyProcessed = true;
00422         }
00423 #endif
00424         
00425     } while (waitForEvent && !anyProcessed);
00426     
00427     return anyProcessed;
00428 }

00431 #ifdef WITH_X11_XINPUT
00432 /* set currently using tablet mode (stylus or eraser) depending on device ID */
00433 static void setTabletMode(GHOST_WindowX11 * window, XID deviceid)
00434 {
00435     if(deviceid == window->GetXTablet().StylusID)
00436         window->GetXTablet().CommonData.Active= GHOST_kTabletModeStylus;
00437     else if(deviceid == window->GetXTablet().EraserID)
00438         window->GetXTablet().CommonData.Active= GHOST_kTabletModeEraser;
00439 }
00440 #endif /* WITH_X11_XINPUT */
00441 
00442     void
00443 GHOST_SystemX11::processEvent(XEvent *xe)
00444 {
00445     GHOST_WindowX11 * window = findGhostWindow(xe->xany.window);    
00446     GHOST_Event * g_event = NULL;
00447 
00448     if (!window) {
00449         return;
00450     }
00451     
00452     switch (xe->type) {
00453         case Expose:
00454         {
00455             XExposeEvent & xee = xe->xexpose;
00456 
00457             if (xee.count == 0) {
00458                 // Only generate a single expose event
00459                 // per read of the event queue.
00460 
00461                 g_event = new
00462                 GHOST_Event(
00463                     getMilliSeconds(),
00464                     GHOST_kEventWindowUpdate,
00465                     window
00466                 );
00467             }
00468             break;
00469         }
00470 
00471         case MotionNotify:
00472         {
00473             XMotionEvent &xme = xe->xmotion;
00474             
00475             if(window->getCursorGrabMode() != GHOST_kGrabDisable && window->getCursorGrabMode() != GHOST_kGrabNormal)
00476             {
00477                 GHOST_TInt32 x_new= xme.x_root;
00478                 GHOST_TInt32 y_new= xme.y_root;
00479                 GHOST_TInt32 x_accum, y_accum;
00480                 GHOST_Rect bounds;
00481 
00482                 /* fallback to window bounds */
00483                 if(window->getCursorGrabBounds(bounds)==GHOST_kFailure)
00484                     window->getClientBounds(bounds);
00485 
00486                 /* could also clamp to screen bounds
00487                  * wrap with a window outside the view will fail atm  */
00488                 bounds.wrapPoint(x_new, y_new, 8); /* offset of one incase blender is at screen bounds */
00489                 window->getCursorGrabAccum(x_accum, y_accum);
00490 
00491                 if(x_new != xme.x_root || y_new != xme.y_root) {
00492                     if (xme.time > m_last_warp) {
00493                         /* when wrapping we don't need to add an event because the
00494                          * setCursorPosition call will cause a new event after */
00495                         setCursorPosition(x_new, y_new); /* wrap */
00496                         window->setCursorGrabAccum(x_accum + (xme.x_root - x_new), y_accum + (xme.y_root - y_new));
00497                         m_last_warp = lastEventTime(xme.time);
00498                     } else {
00499                         setCursorPosition(x_new, y_new); /* wrap but don't accumulate */
00500                     }
00501                 }
00502                 else {
00503                     g_event = new
00504                     GHOST_EventCursor(
00505                         getMilliSeconds(),
00506                         GHOST_kEventCursorMove,
00507                         window,
00508                         xme.x_root + x_accum,
00509                         xme.y_root + y_accum
00510                     );
00511                 }
00512             }
00513             else {
00514                 g_event = new
00515                 GHOST_EventCursor(
00516                     getMilliSeconds(),
00517                     GHOST_kEventCursorMove,
00518                     window,
00519                     xme.x_root,
00520                     xme.y_root
00521                 );
00522             }
00523             break;
00524         }
00525 
00526         case KeyPress:
00527         case KeyRelease:
00528         {
00529             XKeyEvent *xke = &(xe->xkey);
00530             KeySym key_sym = XLookupKeysym(xke,0);
00531             char ascii;
00532             char utf8_buf[6]; /* 6 is enough for a utf8 char */
00533             
00534             GHOST_TKey gkey = convertXKey(key_sym);
00535             GHOST_TEventType type = (xke->type == KeyPress) ? 
00536                 GHOST_kEventKeyDown : GHOST_kEventKeyUp;
00537             
00538             if (!XLookupString(xke, &ascii, 1, NULL, NULL)) {
00539                 ascii = '\0';
00540             }
00541             
00542 #if defined(WITH_X11_XINPUT) && defined(X_HAVE_UTF8_STRING)
00543             /* getting unicode on key-up events gives XLookupNone status */
00544             if (xke->type == KeyPress) {
00545                 Status status;
00546                 int len;
00547 
00548                 /* use utf8 because its not locale depentant, from xorg docs */
00549                 if (!(len= Xutf8LookupString(window->getX11_XIC(), xke, utf8_buf, sizeof(utf8_buf), &key_sym, &status))) {
00550                     utf8_buf[0]= '\0';
00551                 }
00552 
00553                 if ((status == XLookupChars || status == XLookupBoth)) {
00554                     if ((unsigned char)utf8_buf[0] >= 32) { /* not an ascii control character */
00555                         /* do nothing for now, this is valid utf8 */
00556                     }
00557                     else {
00558                         utf8_buf[0]= '\0';
00559                     }
00560                 }
00561                 else if (status == XLookupKeySym) {
00562                     /* this key doesn't have a text representation, it is a command
00563                        key of some sort */;
00564                 }
00565                 else {
00566                     printf("Bad keycode lookup. Keysym 0x%x Status: %s\n",
00567                               (unsigned int) key_sym,
00568                               (status == XBufferOverflow ? "BufferOverflow" :
00569                                status == XLookupNone ? "XLookupNone" :
00570                                status == XLookupKeySym ? "XLookupKeySym" :
00571                                "Unknown status"));
00572 
00573                     printf("'%.*s' %p %p\n", len, utf8_buf, window->getX11_XIC(), m_xim);
00574                 }
00575             }
00576             else {
00577                 utf8_buf[0]= '\0';
00578             }
00579 #else
00580             utf8_buf[0]= '\0';
00581 #endif
00582 
00583             g_event = new
00584             GHOST_EventKey(
00585                 getMilliSeconds(),
00586                 type,
00587                 window,
00588                 gkey,
00589                 ascii,
00590                 utf8_buf
00591             );
00592             
00593         break;
00594         }
00595 
00596         case ButtonPress:
00597         case ButtonRelease:
00598         {
00599             XButtonEvent & xbe = xe->xbutton;
00600             GHOST_TButtonMask gbmask = GHOST_kButtonMaskLeft;
00601             GHOST_TEventType type = (xbe.type == ButtonPress) ? 
00602                 GHOST_kEventButtonDown : GHOST_kEventButtonUp;
00603 
00604             /* process wheel mouse events and break, only pass on press events */
00605             if(xbe.button == Button4) {
00606                 if(xbe.type == ButtonPress)
00607                     g_event = new GHOST_EventWheel(getMilliSeconds(), window, 1);
00608                 break;
00609             }
00610             else if(xbe.button == Button5) {
00611                 if(xbe.type == ButtonPress)
00612                     g_event = new GHOST_EventWheel(getMilliSeconds(), window, -1);
00613                 break;
00614             }
00615             
00616             /* process rest of normal mouse buttons */
00617             if(xbe.button == Button1)
00618                 gbmask = GHOST_kButtonMaskLeft;
00619             else if(xbe.button == Button2)
00620                 gbmask = GHOST_kButtonMaskMiddle;
00621             else if(xbe.button == Button3)
00622                 gbmask = GHOST_kButtonMaskRight;
00623             /* It seems events 6 and 7 are for horizontal scrolling.
00624             * you can re-order button mapping like this... (swaps 6,7 with 8,9)
00625             *   xmodmap -e "pointer = 1 2 3 4 5 8 9 6 7" 
00626             */
00627             else if(xbe.button == 8)
00628                 gbmask = GHOST_kButtonMaskButton4;
00629             else if(xbe.button == 9)
00630                 gbmask = GHOST_kButtonMaskButton5;
00631             else
00632                 break;
00633 
00634             g_event = new
00635             GHOST_EventButton(
00636                 getMilliSeconds(),
00637                 type,
00638                 window,
00639                 gbmask
00640             );
00641             break;
00642         }
00643             
00644             // change of size, border, layer etc.
00645         case ConfigureNotify:
00646         {
00647             /* XConfigureEvent & xce = xe->xconfigure; */
00648 
00649             g_event = new 
00650             GHOST_Event(
00651                 getMilliSeconds(),
00652                 GHOST_kEventWindowSize,
00653                 window
00654             );          
00655             break;
00656         }
00657 
00658         case FocusIn:
00659         case FocusOut:
00660         {
00661             XFocusChangeEvent &xfe = xe->xfocus;
00662 
00663             // TODO: make sure this is the correct place for activate/deactivate
00664             // printf("X: focus %s for window %d\n", xfe.type == FocusIn ? "in" : "out", (int) xfe.window);
00665         
00666             // May have to look at the type of event and filter some
00667             // out.
00668                                     
00669             GHOST_TEventType gtype = (xfe.type == FocusIn) ? 
00670                 GHOST_kEventWindowActivate : GHOST_kEventWindowDeactivate;
00671 
00672             g_event = new 
00673             GHOST_Event(    
00674                 getMilliSeconds(),
00675                 gtype,
00676                 window
00677             );
00678             break;
00679 
00680         }
00681         case ClientMessage:
00682         {
00683             XClientMessageEvent & xcme = xe->xclient;
00684 
00685             if (((Atom)xcme.data.l[0]) == m_delete_window_atom) {
00686                 g_event = new 
00687                 GHOST_Event(    
00688                     getMilliSeconds(),
00689                     GHOST_kEventWindowClose,
00690                     window
00691                 );
00692             }
00693             else if (((Atom)xcme.data.l[0]) == m_wm_take_focus) {
00694                 XWindowAttributes attr;
00695                 Window fwin;
00696                 int revert_to;
00697 
00698                 /* as ICCCM say, we need reply this event
00699                  * with a SetInputFocus, the data[1] have
00700                  * the valid timestamp (send by the wm).
00701                  *
00702                  * Some WM send this event before the
00703                  * window is really mapped (for example
00704                  * change from virtual desktop), so we need
00705                  * to be sure that our windows is mapped
00706                  * or this call fail and close blender.
00707                  */
00708                 if (XGetWindowAttributes(m_display, xcme.window, &attr) == True) {
00709                     if (XGetInputFocus(m_display, &fwin, &revert_to) == True) {
00710                         if (attr.map_state == IsViewable) {
00711                             if (fwin != xcme.window)
00712                                 XSetInputFocus(m_display, xcme.window, RevertToParent, xcme.data.l[1]);
00713                         }
00714                     }
00715                 }
00716             } else {
00717 #ifdef WITH_XDND
00718                 /* try to handle drag event (if there's no such events, GHOST_HandleClientMessage will return zero) */
00719                 if (window->getDropTarget()->GHOST_HandleClientMessage(xe) == false) {
00720                     /* Unknown client message, ignore */
00721                 }
00722 #else
00723                 /* Unknown client message, ignore */
00724 #endif
00725             }
00726 
00727             break;
00728         }
00729         
00730         case DestroyNotify:
00731 			::exit(-1);  
00732         // We're not interested in the following things.(yet...)
00733         case NoExpose : 
00734         case GraphicsExpose :
00735             break;
00736         
00737         case EnterNotify:
00738         case LeaveNotify:
00739         {
00740             /* XCrossingEvents pointer leave enter window.
00741                also do cursor move here, MotionNotify only
00742                happens when motion starts & ends inside window.
00743                we only do moves when the crossing mode is 'normal'
00744                (really crossing between windows) since some windowmanagers
00745                also send grab/ungrab crossings for mousewheel events.
00746             */
00747             XCrossingEvent &xce = xe->xcrossing;
00748             if( xce.mode == NotifyNormal ) {
00749                 g_event = new 
00750                 GHOST_EventCursor(
00751                     getMilliSeconds(),
00752                     GHOST_kEventCursorMove,
00753                     window,
00754                     xce.x_root,
00755                     xce.y_root
00756                 );
00757             }
00758 
00759             // printf("X: %s window %d\n", xce.type == EnterNotify ? "entering" : "leaving", (int) xce.window);
00760 
00761             if (xce.type == EnterNotify)
00762                 m_windowManager->setActiveWindow(window);
00763             else
00764                 m_windowManager->setWindowInactive(window);
00765 
00766             break;
00767         }
00768         case MapNotify:
00769             /*
00770              * From ICCCM:
00771              * [ Clients can select for StructureNotify on their
00772              *   top-level windows to track transition between
00773              *   Normal and Iconic states. Receipt of a MapNotify
00774              *   event will indicate a transition to the Normal
00775              *   state, and receipt of an UnmapNotify event will
00776              *   indicate a transition to the Iconic state. ]
00777              */
00778             if (window->m_post_init == True) {
00779                 /*
00780                  * Now we are sure that the window is
00781                  * mapped, so only need change the state.
00782                  */
00783                 window->setState (window->m_post_state);
00784                 window->m_post_init = False;
00785             }
00786             break;
00787         case UnmapNotify:
00788             break;
00789         case MappingNotify:
00790         case ReparentNotify:
00791             break;
00792         case SelectionRequest:
00793         {
00794             XEvent nxe;
00795             Atom target, utf8_string, string, compound_text, c_string;
00796             XSelectionRequestEvent *xse = &xe->xselectionrequest;
00797             
00798             target = XInternAtom(m_display, "TARGETS", False);
00799             utf8_string = XInternAtom(m_display, "UTF8_STRING", False);
00800             string = XInternAtom(m_display, "STRING", False);
00801             compound_text = XInternAtom(m_display, "COMPOUND_TEXT", False);
00802             c_string = XInternAtom(m_display, "C_STRING", False);
00803             
00804             /* support obsolete clients */
00805             if (xse->property == None) {
00806                 xse->property = xse->target;
00807             }
00808             
00809             nxe.xselection.type = SelectionNotify;
00810             nxe.xselection.requestor = xse->requestor;
00811             nxe.xselection.property = xse->property;
00812             nxe.xselection.display = xse->display;
00813             nxe.xselection.selection = xse->selection;
00814             nxe.xselection.target = xse->target;
00815             nxe.xselection.time = xse->time;
00816             
00817             /*Check to see if the requestor is asking for String*/
00818             if(xse->target == utf8_string || xse->target == string || xse->target == compound_text || xse->target == c_string) {
00819                 if (xse->selection == XInternAtom(m_display, "PRIMARY", False)) {
00820                     XChangeProperty(m_display, xse->requestor, xse->property, xse->target, 8, PropModeReplace,
00821                                     (unsigned char*)txt_select_buffer, strlen(txt_select_buffer));
00822                 } else if (xse->selection == XInternAtom(m_display, "CLIPBOARD", False)) {
00823                     XChangeProperty(m_display, xse->requestor, xse->property, xse->target, 8, PropModeReplace,
00824                                     (unsigned char*)txt_cut_buffer, strlen(txt_cut_buffer));
00825                 }
00826             } else if (xse->target == target) {
00827                 Atom alist[5];
00828                 alist[0] = target;
00829                 alist[1] = utf8_string;
00830                 alist[2] = string;
00831                 alist[3] = compound_text;
00832                 alist[4] = c_string;
00833                 XChangeProperty(m_display, xse->requestor, xse->property, xse->target, 32, PropModeReplace,
00834                                 (unsigned char*)alist, 5);
00835                 XFlush(m_display);
00836             } else  {
00837                 //Change property to None because we do not support anything but STRING
00838                 nxe.xselection.property = None;
00839             }
00840             
00841             //Send the event to the client 0 0 == False, SelectionNotify
00842             XSendEvent(m_display, xse->requestor, 0, 0, &nxe);
00843             XFlush(m_display);
00844             break;
00845         }
00846         
00847         default: {
00848 #ifdef WITH_X11_XINPUT
00849             if(xe->type == window->GetXTablet().MotionEvent) 
00850             {
00851                 XDeviceMotionEvent* data = (XDeviceMotionEvent*)xe;
00852 
00853                 /* stroke might begin without leading ProxyIn event,
00854                  * this happens when window is opened when stylus is already hovering
00855                  * around tablet surface */
00856                 setTabletMode(window, data->deviceid);
00857 
00858                 window->GetXTablet().CommonData.Pressure= 
00859                     data->axis_data[2]/((float)window->GetXTablet().PressureLevels);
00860             
00861             /* the (short) cast and the &0xffff is bizarre and unexplained anywhere,
00862              * but I got garbage data without it. Found it in the xidump.c source --matt */
00863                 window->GetXTablet().CommonData.Xtilt= 
00864                     (short)(data->axis_data[3]&0xffff)/((float)window->GetXTablet().XtiltLevels);
00865                 window->GetXTablet().CommonData.Ytilt= 
00866                     (short)(data->axis_data[4]&0xffff)/((float)window->GetXTablet().YtiltLevels);
00867             }
00868             else if(xe->type == window->GetXTablet().ProxInEvent) 
00869             {
00870                 XProximityNotifyEvent* data = (XProximityNotifyEvent*)xe;
00871 
00872                 setTabletMode(window, data->deviceid);
00873             }
00874             else if(xe->type == window->GetXTablet().ProxOutEvent)
00875                 window->GetXTablet().CommonData.Active= GHOST_kTabletModeNone;
00876 #endif // WITH_X11_XINPUT
00877             break;
00878         }
00879     }
00880 
00881     if (g_event) {
00882         pushEvent(g_event);
00883     }
00884 }
00885 
00886     GHOST_TSuccess 
00887 GHOST_SystemX11::
00888 getModifierKeys(
00889     GHOST_ModifierKeys& keys
00890 ) const {
00891 
00892     // analyse the masks retuned from XQueryPointer.
00893 
00894     memset((void *)m_keyboard_vector,0,sizeof(m_keyboard_vector));
00895 
00896     XQueryKeymap(m_display,(char *)m_keyboard_vector);
00897 
00898     // now translate key symobols into keycodes and
00899     // test with vector.
00900 
00901     const static KeyCode shift_l = XKeysymToKeycode(m_display,XK_Shift_L);
00902     const static KeyCode shift_r = XKeysymToKeycode(m_display,XK_Shift_R);
00903     const static KeyCode control_l = XKeysymToKeycode(m_display,XK_Control_L);
00904     const static KeyCode control_r = XKeysymToKeycode(m_display,XK_Control_R);
00905     const static KeyCode alt_l = XKeysymToKeycode(m_display,XK_Alt_L);
00906     const static KeyCode alt_r = XKeysymToKeycode(m_display,XK_Alt_R);
00907     const static KeyCode super_l = XKeysymToKeycode(m_display,XK_Super_L);
00908     const static KeyCode super_r = XKeysymToKeycode(m_display,XK_Super_R);
00909 
00910     // shift
00911     keys.set(GHOST_kModifierKeyLeftShift, ((m_keyboard_vector[shift_l >> 3] >> (shift_l & 7)) & 1) != 0);
00912     keys.set(GHOST_kModifierKeyRightShift, ((m_keyboard_vector[shift_r >> 3] >> (shift_r & 7)) & 1) != 0);
00913     // control
00914     keys.set(GHOST_kModifierKeyLeftControl, ((m_keyboard_vector[control_l >> 3] >> (control_l & 7)) & 1) != 0);
00915     keys.set(GHOST_kModifierKeyRightControl, ((m_keyboard_vector[control_r >> 3] >> (control_r & 7)) & 1) != 0);
00916     // alt
00917     keys.set(GHOST_kModifierKeyLeftAlt, ((m_keyboard_vector[alt_l >> 3] >> (alt_l & 7)) & 1) != 0);
00918     keys.set(GHOST_kModifierKeyRightAlt, ((m_keyboard_vector[alt_r >> 3] >> (alt_r & 7)) & 1) != 0);
00919     // super (windows) - only one GHOST-kModifierKeyOS, so mapping to either
00920     keys.set(GHOST_kModifierKeyOS, ( ((m_keyboard_vector[super_l >> 3] >> (super_l & 7)) & 1) ||
00921                                      ((m_keyboard_vector[super_r >> 3] >> (super_r & 7)) & 1) ) != 0);
00922 
00923     return GHOST_kSuccess;
00924 }
00925 
00926     GHOST_TSuccess 
00927 GHOST_SystemX11::
00928 getButtons(
00929     GHOST_Buttons& buttons
00930 ) const {
00931 
00932     Window root_return, child_return;
00933     int rx,ry,wx,wy;
00934     unsigned int mask_return;
00935 
00936     if (XQueryPointer(m_display,
00937                       RootWindow(m_display,DefaultScreen(m_display)),
00938                       &root_return,
00939                       &child_return,
00940                       &rx,&ry,
00941                       &wx,&wy,
00942                       &mask_return) == True)
00943     {
00944         buttons.set(GHOST_kButtonMaskLeft,   (mask_return & Button1Mask) != 0);
00945         buttons.set(GHOST_kButtonMaskMiddle, (mask_return & Button2Mask) != 0);
00946         buttons.set(GHOST_kButtonMaskRight,  (mask_return & Button3Mask) != 0);
00947     }
00948     else {
00949         return GHOST_kFailure;
00950     }   
00951 
00952     return GHOST_kSuccess;
00953 }
00954 
00955 
00956     GHOST_TSuccess 
00957 GHOST_SystemX11::
00958 getCursorPosition(
00959     GHOST_TInt32& x,
00960     GHOST_TInt32& y
00961 ) const {
00962 
00963     Window root_return, child_return;
00964     int rx,ry,wx,wy;
00965     unsigned int mask_return;
00966 
00967     if (XQueryPointer(
00968         m_display,
00969         RootWindow(m_display,DefaultScreen(m_display)),
00970         &root_return,
00971         &child_return,
00972         &rx,&ry,
00973         &wx,&wy,
00974         &mask_return
00975     ) == False) {
00976         return GHOST_kFailure;
00977     } else {
00978         x = rx;
00979         y = ry;
00980     }   
00981     return GHOST_kSuccess;
00982 }
00983 
00984 
00985     GHOST_TSuccess 
00986 GHOST_SystemX11::
00987 setCursorPosition(
00988     GHOST_TInt32 x,
00989     GHOST_TInt32 y
00990 ) {
00991 
00992     // This is a brute force move in screen coordinates
00993     // XWarpPointer does relative moves so first determine the
00994     // current pointer position.
00995 
00996     int cx,cy;
00997     if (getCursorPosition(cx,cy) == GHOST_kFailure) {
00998         return GHOST_kFailure;
00999     }
01000 
01001     int relx = x-cx;
01002     int rely = y-cy;
01003 
01004     XWarpPointer(m_display,None,None,0,0,0,0,relx,rely);
01005     XSync(m_display, 0); /* Sync to process all requests */
01006     
01007     return GHOST_kSuccess;
01008 }
01009 
01010 
01011     void
01012 GHOST_SystemX11::
01013 addDirtyWindow(
01014     GHOST_WindowX11 * bad_wind
01015 ){
01016 
01017     GHOST_ASSERT((bad_wind != NULL), "addDirtyWindow() NULL ptr trapped (window)");
01018     
01019     m_dirty_windows.push_back(bad_wind);
01020 }
01021 
01022 
01023     bool
01024 GHOST_SystemX11::
01025 generateWindowExposeEvents(
01026 ){
01027 
01028     vector<GHOST_WindowX11 *>::iterator w_start = m_dirty_windows.begin();
01029     vector<GHOST_WindowX11 *>::const_iterator w_end = m_dirty_windows.end();
01030     bool anyProcessed = false;
01031     
01032     for (;w_start != w_end; ++w_start) {
01033         GHOST_Event * g_event = new 
01034             GHOST_Event(
01035                 getMilliSeconds(),
01036                 GHOST_kEventWindowUpdate,
01037                 *w_start
01038             );          
01039 
01040         (*w_start)->validate(); 
01041         
01042         if (g_event) {
01043             pushEvent(g_event);
01044             anyProcessed = true;
01045         }
01046     }
01047 
01048     m_dirty_windows.clear();
01049     return anyProcessed;
01050 }
01051 
01052 #define GXMAP(k,x,y) case x: k = y; break; 
01053 
01054 static GHOST_TKey
01055 convertXKey(KeySym key)
01056 {
01057     GHOST_TKey type;
01058 
01059     if ((key >= XK_A) && (key <= XK_Z)) {
01060         type = GHOST_TKey( key - XK_A + int(GHOST_kKeyA));
01061     } else if ((key >= XK_a) && (key <= XK_z)) {
01062         type = GHOST_TKey(key - XK_a + int(GHOST_kKeyA));
01063     } else if ((key >= XK_0) && (key <= XK_9)) {
01064         type = GHOST_TKey(key - XK_0 + int(GHOST_kKey0));
01065     } else if ((key >= XK_F1) && (key <= XK_F24)) {
01066         type = GHOST_TKey(key - XK_F1 + int(GHOST_kKeyF1));
01067 #if defined(__sun) || defined(__sun__) 
01068         /* This is a bit of a hack, but it looks like sun
01069            Used F11 and friends for its special keys Stop,again etc..
01070            So this little patch enables F11 and F12 to work as expected
01071            following link has documentation on it: 
01072            http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=4734408
01073            also from /usr/include/X11/Sunkeysym.h 
01074 #define SunXK_F36               0x1005FF10      // Labeled F11
01075 #define SunXK_F37               0x1005FF11      // Labeled F12 
01076 
01077                 mein@cs.umn.edu
01078          */
01079         
01080     } else if (key == 268828432) {
01081         type = GHOST_kKeyF11;
01082     } else if (key == 268828433) {
01083         type = GHOST_kKeyF12;
01084 #endif
01085     } else {
01086         switch(key) {
01087             GXMAP(type,XK_BackSpace,    GHOST_kKeyBackSpace);
01088             GXMAP(type,XK_Tab,          GHOST_kKeyTab);
01089             GXMAP(type,XK_Return,       GHOST_kKeyEnter);
01090             GXMAP(type,XK_Escape,       GHOST_kKeyEsc);
01091             GXMAP(type,XK_space,        GHOST_kKeySpace);
01092             
01093             GXMAP(type,XK_Linefeed,     GHOST_kKeyLinefeed);
01094             GXMAP(type,XK_semicolon,    GHOST_kKeySemicolon);
01095             GXMAP(type,XK_period,       GHOST_kKeyPeriod);
01096             GXMAP(type,XK_comma,        GHOST_kKeyComma);
01097             GXMAP(type,XK_quoteright,   GHOST_kKeyQuote);
01098             GXMAP(type,XK_quoteleft,    GHOST_kKeyAccentGrave);
01099             GXMAP(type,XK_minus,        GHOST_kKeyMinus);
01100             GXMAP(type,XK_slash,        GHOST_kKeySlash);
01101             GXMAP(type,XK_backslash,    GHOST_kKeyBackslash);
01102             GXMAP(type,XK_equal,        GHOST_kKeyEqual);
01103             GXMAP(type,XK_bracketleft,  GHOST_kKeyLeftBracket);
01104             GXMAP(type,XK_bracketright, GHOST_kKeyRightBracket);
01105             GXMAP(type,XK_Pause,        GHOST_kKeyPause);
01106             
01107             GXMAP(type,XK_Shift_L,      GHOST_kKeyLeftShift);
01108             GXMAP(type,XK_Shift_R,      GHOST_kKeyRightShift);
01109             GXMAP(type,XK_Control_L,    GHOST_kKeyLeftControl);
01110             GXMAP(type,XK_Control_R,    GHOST_kKeyRightControl);
01111             GXMAP(type,XK_Alt_L,        GHOST_kKeyLeftAlt);
01112             GXMAP(type,XK_Alt_R,        GHOST_kKeyRightAlt);
01113             GXMAP(type,XK_Super_L,      GHOST_kKeyOS);
01114             GXMAP(type,XK_Super_R,      GHOST_kKeyOS);
01115 
01116             GXMAP(type,XK_Insert,       GHOST_kKeyInsert);
01117             GXMAP(type,XK_Delete,       GHOST_kKeyDelete);
01118             GXMAP(type,XK_Home,         GHOST_kKeyHome);
01119             GXMAP(type,XK_End,          GHOST_kKeyEnd);
01120             GXMAP(type,XK_Page_Up,      GHOST_kKeyUpPage);
01121             GXMAP(type,XK_Page_Down,    GHOST_kKeyDownPage);
01122 
01123             GXMAP(type,XK_Left,         GHOST_kKeyLeftArrow);
01124             GXMAP(type,XK_Right,        GHOST_kKeyRightArrow);
01125             GXMAP(type,XK_Up,           GHOST_kKeyUpArrow);
01126             GXMAP(type,XK_Down,         GHOST_kKeyDownArrow);
01127 
01128             GXMAP(type,XK_Caps_Lock,    GHOST_kKeyCapsLock);
01129             GXMAP(type,XK_Scroll_Lock,  GHOST_kKeyScrollLock);
01130             GXMAP(type,XK_Num_Lock,     GHOST_kKeyNumLock);
01131             
01132                 /* keypad events */
01133                 
01134             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_0,         GHOST_kKeyNumpad0);
01135             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_1,         GHOST_kKeyNumpad1);
01136             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_2,         GHOST_kKeyNumpad2);
01137             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_3,         GHOST_kKeyNumpad3);
01138             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_4,         GHOST_kKeyNumpad4);
01139             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_5,         GHOST_kKeyNumpad5);
01140             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_6,         GHOST_kKeyNumpad6);
01141             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_7,         GHOST_kKeyNumpad7);
01142             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_8,         GHOST_kKeyNumpad8);
01143             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_9,         GHOST_kKeyNumpad9);
01144             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_Decimal,   GHOST_kKeyNumpadPeriod);
01145 
01146             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_Insert,    GHOST_kKeyNumpad0);
01147             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_End,       GHOST_kKeyNumpad1);
01148             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_Down,      GHOST_kKeyNumpad2);
01149             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_Page_Down, GHOST_kKeyNumpad3);
01150             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_Left,      GHOST_kKeyNumpad4);
01151             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_Begin,     GHOST_kKeyNumpad5);
01152             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_Right,     GHOST_kKeyNumpad6);
01153             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_Home,      GHOST_kKeyNumpad7);
01154             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_Up,        GHOST_kKeyNumpad8);
01155             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_Page_Up,   GHOST_kKeyNumpad9);
01156             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_Delete,    GHOST_kKeyNumpadPeriod);
01157 
01158             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_Enter,     GHOST_kKeyNumpadEnter);
01159             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_Add,       GHOST_kKeyNumpadPlus);
01160             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_Subtract,  GHOST_kKeyNumpadMinus);
01161             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_Multiply,  GHOST_kKeyNumpadAsterisk);
01162             GXMAP(type,XK_KP_Divide,    GHOST_kKeyNumpadSlash);
01163 
01164             /* Media keys in some keyboards and laptops with XFree86/Xorg */
01165 #ifdef WITH_XF86KEYSYM
01166             GXMAP(type,XF86XK_AudioPlay,    GHOST_kKeyMediaPlay);
01167             GXMAP(type,XF86XK_AudioStop,    GHOST_kKeyMediaStop);
01168             GXMAP(type,XF86XK_AudioPrev,    GHOST_kKeyMediaFirst);
01169             GXMAP(type,XF86XK_AudioRewind,  GHOST_kKeyMediaFirst);
01170             GXMAP(type,XF86XK_AudioNext,    GHOST_kKeyMediaLast);
01171 #ifdef XF86XK_AudioForward /* Debian lenny's XF86keysym.h has no XF86XK_AudioForward define */
01172             GXMAP(type,XF86XK_AudioForward, GHOST_kKeyMediaLast);
01173 #endif
01174 #endif
01175 
01176                 /* some extra sun cruft (NICE KEYBOARD!) */
01177 #ifdef __sun__
01178             GXMAP(type,0xffde,          GHOST_kKeyNumpad1);
01179             GXMAP(type,0xffe0,          GHOST_kKeyNumpad3);
01180             GXMAP(type,0xffdc,          GHOST_kKeyNumpad5);
01181             GXMAP(type,0xffd8,          GHOST_kKeyNumpad7);
01182             GXMAP(type,0xffda,          GHOST_kKeyNumpad9);
01183 
01184             GXMAP(type,0xffd6,          GHOST_kKeyNumpadSlash);
01185             GXMAP(type,0xffd7,          GHOST_kKeyNumpadAsterisk);
01186 #endif
01187 
01188             default :
01189                 type = GHOST_kKeyUnknown;
01190                 break;
01191         }
01192     }
01193 
01194     return type;
01195 }
01196 
01197 #undef GXMAP
01198 
01199 /* from xclip.c xcout() v0.11 */
01200 
01201 #define XCLIB_XCOUT_NONE        0 /* no context */
01202 #define XCLIB_XCOUT_SENTCONVSEL     1 /* sent a request */
01203 #define XCLIB_XCOUT_INCR        2 /* in an incr loop */
01204 #define XCLIB_XCOUT_FALLBACK        3 /* STRING failed, need fallback to UTF8 */
01205 #define XCLIB_XCOUT_FALLBACK_UTF8   4 /* UTF8 failed, move to compouned */
01206 #define XCLIB_XCOUT_FALLBACK_COMP   5 /* compouned failed, move to text. */
01207 #define XCLIB_XCOUT_FALLBACK_TEXT   6
01208 
01209 // Retrieves the contents of a selections.
01210 void GHOST_SystemX11::getClipboard_xcout(XEvent evt,
01211     Atom sel, Atom target, unsigned char **txt,
01212     unsigned long *len, unsigned int *context) const
01213 {
01214     Atom pty_type;
01215     int pty_format;
01216     unsigned char *buffer;
01217     unsigned long pty_size, pty_items;
01218     unsigned char *ltxt= *txt;
01219 
01220     vector<GHOST_IWindow *> & win_vec = m_windowManager->getWindows();
01221     vector<GHOST_IWindow *>::iterator win_it = win_vec.begin();
01222     GHOST_WindowX11 * window = static_cast<GHOST_WindowX11 *>(*win_it);
01223     Window win = window->getXWindow();
01224 
01225     switch (*context) {
01226         // There is no context, do an XConvertSelection()
01227         case XCLIB_XCOUT_NONE:
01228             // Initialise return length to 0
01229             if (*len > 0) {
01230                 free(*txt);
01231                 *len = 0;
01232             }
01233 
01234             // Send a selection request
01235             XConvertSelection(m_display, sel, target, m_xclip_out, win, CurrentTime);
01236             *context = XCLIB_XCOUT_SENTCONVSEL;
01237             return;
01238 
01239         case XCLIB_XCOUT_SENTCONVSEL:
01240             if (evt.type != SelectionNotify)
01241                 return;
01242 
01243             if (target == m_utf8_string && evt.xselection.property == None) {
01244                 *context= XCLIB_XCOUT_FALLBACK_UTF8;
01245                 return;
01246             }
01247             else if (target == m_compound_text && evt.xselection.property == None) {
01248                 *context= XCLIB_XCOUT_FALLBACK_COMP;
01249                 return;
01250             }
01251             else if (target == m_text && evt.xselection.property == None) {
01252                 *context= XCLIB_XCOUT_FALLBACK_TEXT;
01253                 return;
01254             }
01255 
01256             // find the size and format of the data in property
01257             XGetWindowProperty(m_display, win, m_xclip_out, 0, 0, False,
01258                 AnyPropertyType, &pty_type, &pty_format,
01259                 &pty_items, &pty_size, &buffer);
01260             XFree(buffer);
01261 
01262             if (pty_type == m_incr) {
01263                 // start INCR mechanism by deleting property
01264                 XDeleteProperty(m_display, win, m_xclip_out);
01265                 XFlush(m_display);
01266                 *context = XCLIB_XCOUT_INCR;
01267                 return;
01268             }
01269 
01270             // if it's not incr, and not format == 8, then there's
01271             // nothing in the selection (that xclip understands, anyway)
01272 
01273             if (pty_format != 8) {
01274                 *context = XCLIB_XCOUT_NONE;
01275                 return;
01276             }
01277 
01278             // not using INCR mechanism, just read the property
01279             XGetWindowProperty(m_display, win, m_xclip_out, 0, (long) pty_size,
01280                     False, AnyPropertyType, &pty_type,
01281                     &pty_format, &pty_items, &pty_size, &buffer);
01282 
01283             // finished with property, delete it
01284             XDeleteProperty(m_display, win, m_xclip_out);
01285 
01286             // copy the buffer to the pointer for returned data
01287             ltxt = (unsigned char *) malloc(pty_items);
01288             memcpy(ltxt, buffer, pty_items);
01289 
01290             // set the length of the returned data
01291             *len = pty_items;
01292             *txt = ltxt;
01293 
01294             // free the buffer
01295             XFree(buffer);
01296 
01297             *context = XCLIB_XCOUT_NONE;
01298 
01299             // complete contents of selection fetched, return 1
01300             return;
01301 
01302         case XCLIB_XCOUT_INCR:
01303             // To use the INCR method, we basically delete the
01304             // property with the selection in it, wait for an
01305             // event indicating that the property has been created,
01306             // then read it, delete it, etc.
01307 
01308             // make sure that the event is relevant
01309             if (evt.type != PropertyNotify)
01310                 return;
01311 
01312             // skip unless the property has a new value
01313             if (evt.xproperty.state != PropertyNewValue)
01314                 return;
01315 
01316             // check size and format of the property
01317             XGetWindowProperty(m_display, win, m_xclip_out, 0, 0, False,
01318                 AnyPropertyType, &pty_type, &pty_format,
01319                 &pty_items, &pty_size, (unsigned char **) &buffer);
01320 
01321             if (pty_format != 8) {
01322                 // property does not contain text, delete it
01323                 // to tell the other X client that we have read 
01324                 // it and to send the next property
01325                 XFree(buffer);
01326                 XDeleteProperty(m_display, win, m_xclip_out);
01327                 return;
01328             }
01329 
01330             if (pty_size == 0) {
01331                 // no more data, exit from loop
01332                 XFree(buffer);
01333                 XDeleteProperty(m_display, win, m_xclip_out);
01334                 *context = XCLIB_XCOUT_NONE;
01335 
01336                 // this means that an INCR transfer is now
01337                 // complete, return 1
01338                 return;
01339             }
01340 
01341             XFree(buffer);
01342 
01343             // if we have come this far, the propery contains
01344             // text, we know the size.
01345             XGetWindowProperty(m_display, win, m_xclip_out, 0, (long) pty_size,
01346                 False, AnyPropertyType, &pty_type, &pty_format,
01347                 &pty_items, &pty_size, (unsigned char **) &buffer);
01348 
01349             // allocate memory to accommodate data in *txt
01350             if (*len == 0) {
01351                 *len = pty_items;
01352                 ltxt = (unsigned char *) malloc(*len);
01353             }
01354             else {
01355                 *len += pty_items;
01356                 ltxt = (unsigned char *) realloc(ltxt, *len);
01357             }
01358 
01359             // add data to ltxt
01360             memcpy(&ltxt[*len - pty_items], buffer, pty_items);
01361 
01362             *txt = ltxt;
01363             XFree(buffer);
01364 
01365             // delete property to get the next item
01366             XDeleteProperty(m_display, win, m_xclip_out);
01367             XFlush(m_display);
01368             return;
01369     }
01370     return;
01371 }
01372 
01373 GHOST_TUns8 *GHOST_SystemX11::getClipboard(bool selection) const
01374 {
01375     Atom sseln;
01376     Atom target= m_utf8_string;
01377     Window owner;
01378 
01379     // from xclip.c doOut() v0.11
01380     unsigned char *sel_buf;
01381     unsigned long sel_len= 0;
01382     XEvent evt;
01383     unsigned int context= XCLIB_XCOUT_NONE;
01384 
01385     if (selection == True)
01386         sseln= m_primary;
01387     else
01388         sseln= m_clipboard;
01389 
01390     vector<GHOST_IWindow *> & win_vec = m_windowManager->getWindows();
01391     vector<GHOST_IWindow *>::iterator win_it = win_vec.begin();
01392     GHOST_WindowX11 * window = static_cast<GHOST_WindowX11 *>(*win_it);
01393     Window win = window->getXWindow();
01394 
01395     /* check if we are the owner. */
01396     owner= XGetSelectionOwner(m_display, sseln);
01397     if (owner == win) {
01398         if (sseln == m_clipboard) {
01399             sel_buf= (unsigned char *)malloc(strlen(txt_cut_buffer)+1);
01400             strcpy((char *)sel_buf, txt_cut_buffer);
01401             return((GHOST_TUns8*)sel_buf);
01402         }
01403         else {
01404             sel_buf= (unsigned char *)malloc(strlen(txt_select_buffer)+1);
01405             strcpy((char *)sel_buf, txt_select_buffer);
01406             return((GHOST_TUns8*)sel_buf);
01407         }
01408     }
01409     else if (owner == None)
01410         return(NULL);
01411 
01412     while (1) {
01413         /* only get an event if xcout() is doing something */
01414         if (context != XCLIB_XCOUT_NONE)
01415             XNextEvent(m_display, &evt);
01416 
01417         /* fetch the selection, or part of it */
01418         getClipboard_xcout(evt, sseln, target, &sel_buf, &sel_len, &context);
01419 
01420         /* fallback is needed. set XA_STRING to target and restart the loop. */
01421         if (context == XCLIB_XCOUT_FALLBACK) {
01422             context= XCLIB_XCOUT_NONE;
01423             target= m_string;
01424             continue;
01425         }
01426         else if (context == XCLIB_XCOUT_FALLBACK_UTF8) {
01427             /* utf8 fail, move to compouned text. */
01428             context= XCLIB_XCOUT_NONE;
01429             target= m_compound_text;
01430             continue;
01431         }
01432         else if (context == XCLIB_XCOUT_FALLBACK_COMP) {
01433             /* compouned text faile, move to text. */
01434             context= XCLIB_XCOUT_NONE;
01435             target= m_text;
01436             continue;
01437         }
01438 
01439         /* only continue if xcout() is doing something */
01440         if (context == XCLIB_XCOUT_NONE)
01441             break;
01442     }
01443 
01444     if (sel_len) {
01445         /* only print the buffer out, and free it, if it's not
01446          * empty
01447          */
01448         unsigned char *tmp_data = (unsigned char*) malloc(sel_len+1);
01449         memcpy((char*)tmp_data, (char*)sel_buf, sel_len);
01450         tmp_data[sel_len] = '\0';
01451         
01452         if (sseln == m_string)
01453             XFree(sel_buf);
01454         else
01455             free(sel_buf);
01456         
01457         return (GHOST_TUns8*)tmp_data;
01458     }
01459     return(NULL);
01460 }
01461 
01462 void GHOST_SystemX11::putClipboard(GHOST_TInt8 *buffer, bool selection) const
01463 {
01464     Window m_window, owner;
01465 
01466     vector<GHOST_IWindow *> & win_vec = m_windowManager->getWindows();  
01467     vector<GHOST_IWindow *>::iterator win_it = win_vec.begin();
01468     GHOST_WindowX11 * window = static_cast<GHOST_WindowX11 *>(*win_it);
01469     m_window = window->getXWindow();
01470 
01471     if (buffer) {
01472         if (selection == False) {
01473             XSetSelectionOwner(m_display, m_clipboard, m_window, CurrentTime);
01474             owner= XGetSelectionOwner(m_display, m_clipboard);
01475             if (txt_cut_buffer)
01476                 free((void*)txt_cut_buffer);
01477 
01478             txt_cut_buffer = (char*) malloc(strlen(buffer)+1);
01479             strcpy(txt_cut_buffer, buffer);
01480         } else {
01481             XSetSelectionOwner(m_display, m_primary, m_window, CurrentTime);
01482             owner= XGetSelectionOwner(m_display, m_primary);
01483             if (txt_select_buffer)
01484                 free((void*)txt_select_buffer);
01485 
01486             txt_select_buffer = (char*) malloc(strlen(buffer)+1);
01487             strcpy(txt_select_buffer, buffer);
01488         }
01489 
01490         if (owner != m_window)
01491             fprintf(stderr, "failed to own primary\n");
01492     }
01493 }
01494 
01495 #ifdef WITH_XDND
01496 GHOST_TSuccess GHOST_SystemX11::pushDragDropEvent(GHOST_TEventType eventType, 
01497                                                     GHOST_TDragnDropTypes draggedObjectType,
01498                                                     GHOST_IWindow* window,
01499                                                     int mouseX, int mouseY,
01500                                                     void* data)
01501 {
01502     GHOST_SystemX11* system = ((GHOST_SystemX11*)getSystem());
01503     return system->pushEvent(new GHOST_EventDragnDrop(system->getMilliSeconds(),
01504                                                       eventType,
01505                                                       draggedObjectType,
01506                                                       window,mouseX,mouseY,data)
01507             );
01508 }
01509 #endif
